items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Power Grid, Bharat Electronics, DLF, Rail Vikas Nigam, HFCL, Shyam Metalics, ACME Solar, Borosil, Petronet LNG in focus on 20 May
items.description: Stocks to Watch, 20 May: Stocks like CMS Info Systems, GMR Power and Urban Infra, New India Assurance Company, Marksans Pharma, Ami Organics, Bharat Bijlee, Le Travenues Technology, Mangalam Organics, Integrity Infrabuild Developers, Power Grid Corporation of India, Bharat Electronics, DLF, ACME Solar Holdings, Borosil, Petronet LNG, and DOMS Industries will be in focus on May 20.

items.description: Travel market growth, customer stickiness and value-added offerings augur well for the company

items.title: Amber Enterprises executes well, but growth is priced in
items.description: The group’s business diversification strategy is working out and will be bolstered by its entry into new segments

items.title: Agri Picks Report May 20, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Sowing of summer crops in Maharashtra rose more than 21% to 510,538 hectares as of Tuesday from 421,706 hectares a year ago, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Richly-valued defence stocks extend selloff led by shipyard firms, Paras Defence promoters trim stake
items.description: Three promoters of Paras Defence cumulatively sold 13.34 lakh shares of the company in large bulk deals, adding to the selling pressure in the pack which has seen a record run in recent weeks.

items.title: ITC Hotels: Strong Q4; robust growth outlook
items.description: ITC Hotels has a healthy inventory addition pipeline and there is scope for further sweating the current asset portfolio

items.title: Q4 result impact: Karur Vysya Bank, NLC India shares rise 4% on strong earnings, Redington shares up 2%
items.description: The sharp rise in the share prices comes despite a muted sentiment in the overall market, with benchmark indices hovering in the red.

items.title: Pfizer shares jump 11% as profit soars 85% YoY in Q4FY25
items.description: Pfizer’s stock surged up to 11 percent after the pharma giant reported a robust 85 percent year-on-year rise in net profit for the March quarter of FY25

items.title: Why Indian IT companies face a rough ride in the AI era
items.description: AI is both an opportunity and a threat — but the threat comes first, says Enam’s Sridhar Sivaram

items.title: Smallcap, midcap stocks hit brakes after record rally; broader market indices snap 6-day gaining streak
items.description: The broader market indices have more or less mirrored the downturn in the benchmark indices, after several days of outperforming them.

items.title: Rural rush, wedding boom, new bikes set stage for two-wheeler revival in FY26
items.description: A rural resurgence, festive tailwinds and fresh launches are aligning to fuel a major comeback for India’s two-wheeler industry in FY26—despite price hikes and a high base.

items.title: Live: Sensex, Nifty slip over 1% amid broad-based selloff | Closing Bell
items.description:
Broad-based Selloff Grips Markets. Sensex, Nifty Extend Downtrend To Third Day. Sensex Slips Over 800 Pts, Nifty Below 24,700. Midcap, Smallcap Indices Break 6-day Rally. All Sectors Plunge In The Sea Of Red. Nifty Auto Index Top Sectoral Laggard. Nifty 50 Gainers: Coal India, Ongc, Tata Steel
Nifty 50 Losers: Eternal, Bajaj Auto, Hero Moto. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: Selloff in auto stocks intensifies after a four-day rally; Hero Moto, Bajaj, Maruti top losers
items.description: Earlier this month, he said that the Indian government has "offered us a deal where basically they are willing to literally charge us no tariff". The possibility of a trade deal between US and India had earlier boosted the free falling auto stocks.

items.title: Buy SBI Life Insurance Company; target of Rs 2048: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services is bullish on SBI Life Insurance Company has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 2048 in its research report dated May 19, 2025.

items.title: Wall Street slips after winning streak as investors weigh recent gains; tech stocks lead decline
items.description: The pullback comes on the heels of a six-day winning run for the S&P 500—the longest since earlier this month—extending a sharp recovery that began five weeks ago.

items.title: Biggest FII outflow in over two months: Foreign investors sell Rs 10,016 crore, DIIs buy Rs 6,738 crore
items.description: For the year so far, FIIs have been net sellers of shares worth Rs 1.19 lakh crore, while DIIs have net bought Rs 2.37 lakh crore worth of shares.

items.title: Wall Street takes a breather as tech stocks drag, S&P500 snaps six-day gaining streak
items.description: Despite the day’s losses, the broader market remains within striking distance of all-time highs. The S&P 500 had notched six straight gains through Monday—its longest winning streak since early May—before running into resistance.

items.title: S&P500 futures dip, putting six-day winning run in jeopardy; Nvidia in focus
items.description: The pullback in futures comes after a muted yet positive session on Monday, where the S&P 500 inched up 0.09 percent to notch its sixth consecutive gain.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on May 20
items.description: Sensex and Nifty both ended the session over 1% lower with all sectoral indices in the red.
